article_title: Two Found Guilty of Placing Bombs on Canada Day in 2013
article_text:
VANCOUVER, British Columbia—A jury found a Canadian couple guilty Tuesday of plotting to set off pressure-cooker bombs outside British Columbia’s provincial legislature two years ago on Canada Day, when thousands of people were expected to be there.

The jury began deliberating on Sunday morning and returned their verdict late Tuesday against John Nuttall and Amanda Korody. They found the two recent converts to Islam guilty of conspiracy to commit murder and making or possessing an explosive device. The judge in May had...
